tool.name: PacBio read correction
tool.description: Run PacBio read correction using Illumina data
tool.command:
mkdir -p $pacbio_fq.files_path && cd $pacbio_fq.files_path &&
fastqToCA
#if $insert_mean: -insertsize $insert_mean #if $insert_stddev: $insert_stddev #else 0 #end if #end if
-libraryname readlib -technology $technology
#if $input_illumina.ext == "fastq": -type sanger #else if $input_illumina.ext == "fastqsanger": -type sanger #else if $input_illumina.ext == "fastqillumina": -type illumina #else if $input_illumina.ext == "fastqsolexa": -type solexa #end if
#if $paired_end: #if $matepair: -outtie #else -innie #end if
-mates $input_illumina #else -reads $input_illumina #end if
> readlib.frg &&
pacBioToCA
#if $min_length: -length $min_length #end if
#if $partitions: -partitions $partitions #end if
-l pacbio -t $threads
#if $short_reads: -shortReads #end if
#if $manual_coverage.auto_or_manual == "manual": -genomeSize $manual_coverage.genome_size -maxCoverage $manual_coverage.max_cov #end if
#if $cov_cutoff: -coverageCutoff $cov_cutoff #end if
#if $max_gap: -maxGap $max_gap #end if
#if $custom_spec.custom_spec_check: -s $custom_spec.custom_spec_file #else -s ${GALAXY_DATA_INDEX_DIR}/pacbio.spec #end if
-fastq $input_pacbio readlib.frg
2> /dev/null
&& mv pacbio.frg $frgfile && mv pacbio.fastq $pacbio_fq
&& rm -rf $pacbio_fq.files_path

param.name: technology
param.label: What instrument were these reads generated on?
param.option: reads from Illumina; GAIIx, MiSeq, HiSeq; shorter than 160bp
reads from Illumina; GAIIx, MiSeq, HiSeq; any length
reads from PacBio; Circular Consensus Sequence (CSS)
reads from 454 Life Sciences; FLX, Titanium, FLX+

param.name: matepair
param.label: Are these Illumina Mate Pair reads? (Not to be confused with Paired-End reads)

param.name: min_length
param.label: Minimum length of PacBio sequences to correct/output

param.name: threads
param.label: Number of threads to use for correction

param.name: short_reads
param.label: Are the sequences to be corrected less than 100bp?

param.name: genome_size
param.label: Specify the approximate genome size
param.help: This overwrites the coverage parameter and will be used to compute estimated coverage instead of automatically estimating.

param.name: max_cov
param.label: Maximum coverage of PacBio sequences to correct
param.help: Only the longest sequences adding up to this coverage will be corrected.

param.name: cov_cutoff
param.label: Specify the pacBio coverage used to separate repeat copies instead of automatically estimating

param.name: max_gap
param.label: The maximum uncorrected PacBio gap that will be allowed
param.help: When there is no short-read coverage for a region, by default the pipeline will split a PacBio sequence. This option allows a number of PacBio sequences without short-read coverage to remain. For example, specifying 50, will mean 50bp can have no short-read coverage without splitting the PacBio sequence.

tool.help:
**Spec File Options**
There are many options that can be changed in the spec file, it is a text file that can be edited in any text editor. These options can be used in both the pacbio read correction and wgs assembler spec files. Look at the `sourceforge documentation`__ to learn about the different options.
.. __: http://sourceforge.net/apps/mediawiki/wgs-assembler/index.php?title=RunCA#Global_Options
-----
**Default Spec File**
Below is the default spec file used to run the read correction::
# original asm settings utgErrorRate = 0.25 utgErrorLimit = 4.5
cnsErrorRate = 0.25 cgwErrorRate = 0.25 ovlErrorRate = 0.25
ovlStoreMemory = 8000
# grid info useGrid = 0 scriptOnGrid = 0 frgCorrOnGrid = 0 ovlCorrOnGrid = 0
ovlConcurrency = 2 ovlThreads = 1 ovlHashBits = 24 ovlHashBlockLength = 500000000 ovlRefBlockSize = 50000000
merSize=14 merylMemory = 4000 merylThreads = 2
frgCorrThreads = 2 frgCorrBatchSize = 100000 frgCorrConcurrency = 1 ovlCorrBatchSize = 200000 ovlCorrConcurrency = 2
cnsConcurrency = 2
